thread.title: Cardinals have Matt Harvey scenario — and maybe botched it
thread.title_full: Cardinals have Matt Harvey scenario — and maybe botched it | New York Post

author: Joel Sherman
title: Cardinals have Matt Harvey scenario — and maybe botched it
text:
In New York, we focus hard on the Matt Harvey innings debate and whether limitations are right or whether pushing for a championship means putting some concerns on the backburner.
But this is a debate that has been held elsewhere. The Cardinals tried to be cautious with Carlos Martinez and Michael Wacha, but ultimately both have ventured far into inning regions never before reached.
Martinez never had exceeded the 108 innings he pitched between the majors and minors in 2013, throwing just 104 1/3 innings mainly as a reliever last year. This season, he was terrific with a 14-7 record and 3.01 ERA, but on Sept. 25, at 179 2/3 innings, he suffered a shoulder strain and was ruled out for the rest of the season and playoffs.
Wacha never had thrown more than 149 2/3 innings he did in 2013 between the majors and minors. That dipped to 109 innings last year as he dealt with a shoulder ailment. He is at 181 1/3 innings after getting swatted for six runs in four innings Wednesday by the Pirates.
Wacha has yielded 21 runs in 24 innings covering five September starts, walking 18 against 19 strikeouts with seven homers permitted. In the first half – covering 17 starts – Wacha allowed seven homers and walked just 24 in 107 1-3 innings
The Cardinals are in the playoffs, but are trying to hold onto to first in the NL Central over the Pirates. Now Martinez is gone, and Wacha is struggling.
  matt harvey ,  mlb playoffs ,  st. louis cardinals
